intro: Cistanthe josetomasallendeana, commonly known as the Josetomasallendean cistanthe, is a species of flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, helping to conserve water. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
